info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Oconee County through 345 PM EDT... At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Walhalla, or 7 miles southwest of Oconee State Park, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Walhalla, Seneca, Westminster, Oconee State Park, Mountain Rest and Long Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
